{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Realtek |model=RTL8197D-11AC Reference Design |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=01/03/2013 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=TX2-RTL8197D-11AC |ic_id=6317A-RTL8197D-11AC |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8197D |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W25Q128FVSG |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16DG-AC |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8812AR |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL,RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi2_chip1_model=RTL8192CE |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL,RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8367RB |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=RTK 11n AP 2.4G,RTK 11n AP 5G |default_ssid_regex=^RTK 11n AP 2.4G$,,, ^RTK 11n AP 5G$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''802.11a/b/g/n/ac RTL8197D+RTL8192CE+RTL8812AR AP Router''
The '''Realtek''' logo and "RTL8197D+RTL8367RB+RTL8192CE+RTL8812A_V230" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :The 5GHz radio is using two [http://www.rfmw.com/datasheets/skyworks/SE5022T_DS.pdf '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE5022T / 5022T 5GHz Power Amplifiers] and two [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SKY85601_11_202865A.pdf '''Skyworks''' SKY85601s (SKY85601-11?) SPDT Switch w/ LNA modules]. :The board is shown with a full size Mini PCIe slot (but no screw posts) in the photos.
Default settings (including the SSIDs) are per the FCC manual. I guess they '''''may''''' be relevant for lazy ''manufacturers'' who just stick the '''Realtek''' SDK on the their devices and do almost nothing else..
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''Powertron''' PA1024-1HUB (100-240VAC ~ 50-60Hz, 0.6A -> 5VDC, 3.0A, 15W max. | efficiency level V).
{{WiFiCert|WFA16991|06/11/2013}}
